oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Report submitted by Lieutenant William Alonzo Wainwright, Regimental Quartermaster of the 75th Indiana Infantry. This monthly departmental form,designated No. 8, names twenty-eight civilian employees due pay. All but one are listed as "Colored" who labored as teamsters. One entry is for a Wagon Master. Six of those named are designated as deserters; all teamsters' entries list amounts to be deducted from their pay for clothing supplied. This is a printed form with handwritten entries.

oai_dc:dc.dc:description: One function of the Quartermaster's Department was to pay non-army personnel for services rendered. Civilians were often hired by the Department as gravediggers, auctioneers, steamboat crews, wagon masters, teamsters, and construction engineers. As Federal forces advanced and occupied new territory, the Quartermaster's Department, often the first Federal agency to employ African Americans, faced the task of distributing clothing, housing, and rations and setting wages.
